title: The Miss Fortune "rework" is nothing more than a band-aid with a massive hidden nerf (Copy f Reddit)
body:
So I've played a lot of MF, over 500 games I would estimate, and am current on her.
These changes are nothing of any consequence.They fix none of her issues, and do 
not help her problem points in any way.

Miss Fortunes problems come from three areas:

1. Miss Fortune has no clear item paths due to obscure scaling.
2. Miss Fortune is a low mobility ADC with no escapes.
3. Miss Fortune is a teamfighter who cannot deal the correct level of damage 
    in the crucial early phase of the fight.

To expand on this.Miss Fortune gets increase magic damage from AD scaling,
via impure shots, which is a nice little version of mixed damage,but the damage is too
low to make any actual difference. Her ult scales with AP for no understandable reason.

A passive of a free pair of mobi boots is terrible on an ADC, since the moment she 
gets hit,she gets slowed, and with no escapes and self peel limited to one weak slow,
she is too easily closed on and killed. The sole consolation is the grievous wounds
allowing her to duel enemies other adcs would be killed by. But now thats gone.

Finally, her ult deals nowhere near enough damage for the difficulty of landing it.
Curse of the Sad Bullet Time is no longer a thing, as even low elo players know to spread
out against tank engages, and a 1400 range spell is no longer "long range". Even if 
you do get it to hit, it deals pitiful damage compared to two seconds of Crit auto 
attacks from other adcs.

Miss Fortune could have been easily upgraded into a modern ADC with some simple 
changes.

1.  The magic damage from impure shots, both on auto attacks and ult benefit from
    crit chance the same way ashe does. This rewards following standard ADC build 
    paths of AD/AS/Crit, rather than having to attempt to stack AD/MPen/PPen in some
    oddball combo.

2. Miss Fortune should be rewarded for standing and fighting instead of running away.
    Her Passive is to set her up for the fight, then she stands there and blasts you away.
   Grievous wounds on the impure shots active helped, but placing more utility into make
    it rain,such as a hybrid shred of some sorts would definitely help her go toe to toe with
    people who manage to dive through to her.

3. Others have said that the number of Bullet Time waves should increase with As, but thats
     lucians gig. A simple base value buff and AD scaling would be enough, when combined 
    with the hybrid shred of make it rain and the crit chance scaling of impure shots.
    It is difficult to get two seconds of uninterrupted channel, at only 1400 range (to the 
     backline),as an ADC. It should be rewarded.

Miss Fortunes game-play identity is completely anchored in the big teamfight.Unlike other 
teamfight ADCs such as Graves or Varus, Miss Fortune is not mobile, is not bursty,and is not 
focused on control. She is a widespread engine of destruction, who stands there and and 
blasts away. If you close on her, she has the tools to fight you, and if you run, her passive
should help her chase you down.

While the new VFX are nice, the mechanical changes do not help modernise this old champion.

Bait title makes no mention of the actual nerfs. Here's the changes as i see them in the article:
[New] Strut now has increased scaling based on level, and only falls off when Miss Fortune takes direct, non-periodic damage. (BUFF)
[New] If the first shot kills the target, the bounce damage increases. (BUFF)
[New] Activating Impure Shots enables Strut.(BUFF)
Impure Shots doesn't have GW listed(NERF)

Unless I'm missing something here it seems like you're blinded by one nerf even though she got buffing in other areas. At worst this looks like more of a net neutral balance change that makes her less of a hard counter to the likes of a soraka.

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/VPBE

Here's what you're missing champ.  No change to her strut passive in terms of minion aggro (the #1 gripe that MF mains have had forever, fixed simply by giving it the Garen treatment).

Huge nerf to the DOT from Impure Shots active by lowering duration to 3 AAs versus 6 seconds and grievous wounds.

It may not sound like much, but those two areas were her Achilles's Heel.  It was bad before and now Riot is just pouring salt in the wound.

Wait... what? 3 AAs? 50% AS for 3 AAs...  We used to stack %AD damage up to five times. I wonder if that's gone now.

Sounds like my tower pushing days are over.
It's not actually 3 aa's.  The tooltip is incorrect, as the buff still lasts after 3 aa's (and I am pretty sure it remains at 6 seconds).

I'm not saying your wrong, i really hope to God you're right, but the fact that the tooltip says 3 AAs doesn't make me feel good.

The fact that it was even there means it was proposed which is already making my hair white.
Tooltip has been revised. Definitely not 3 autoattacks. Instead, it is buffed to 50% attack speed at level 1 and the cooldown is reduced by 4 seconds. Everything seems happy to me.
Ok, now all they have to do is make Strut not get pinged off by minion aggro mid game, and we're golden.
It appears to only deactivate on damage you take directly to your HP. If you have a bloodthirster, then the shield would keep you protected. That's not exactly midgame, but it's something at least.
I'm fairly certain that it still lasts the duration it does on live.  If they did the 3 AA thing then it should have an obscenely short CD.  Still, a nerf like that would kill MF.

Here's the thing:

1) Number one thing I've always said was that MF's passive is EXTREMELY similar to mobi boots. With that parallel drawn, why on Earth would it NOT deactivate from a minion hitting her? At least now she needs to take "direct, non-periodic damage" for it to fall off, rather than any damage at all. Last I checked, a minion is directly targeting you when you get hit.

2) They gave her a good deal of buffs and yet now we're all bitching about GW...which helps VERY little against tanks that don't have heals in-lane.

Like, they buffed Double Up so it improves damage when you cs with it, making it a stronger poke than it already is (which is already really strong in-lane), they buff Strut so it's harder to remove, and they allow you to freely trigger it by triggering Impure Shots, meaning you have access to instantly triggering a semi-infinite speed-up at your leisure once in a team fight situation. Yet we're whining about a status ailment?

Like, they basically buffed her fleeing/chasing as well as her in-lane bullying, but we're now whining over a status ailment being shaved in order to buff that in-lane bullying? How about we just don't buff Miss Fortune so we don't have to hear it?

> 1) Number one thing I've always said was that MF's passive is EXTREMELY similar to mobi boots. With that parallel drawn, why on Earth would it NOT deactivate from a minion hitting her? At least now she needs to take "direct, non-periodic damage" for it to fall off, rather than any damage at all. Last I checked, a minion is directly targeting you when you get hit.

But it's ok on Teemo right?  Teemo's passive doesn't get knocked off by minion aggro, only by turrets and champion damage.

So why is it ok to but MF though that unecessary bullshit, but fucking Teemo, #5 of my top ten champions that make me want to punch a baby, gets a free pass?  Is it because it's lesser?  Then just nerf the movespeed!  I don't care if her MS drops to 365 instead of 395 as long as it won't just get randomly popped off by a caster minion!

> They gave her a good deal of buffs and yet now we're all bitching about GW...which helps VERY little against tanks that don't have heals in-lane.

Two words.  Health regeneration.  I'll give you two more.  Spirit Visage.  Two more.  Ravenous Hydra.  Another four.  Aegis of the Legion.  Two more.  Crystaline Bracer.  Two more.  Warmog's Armor.  Should I continue?

> Like, they buffed Double Up so it improves damage when you cs with it, making it a stronger poke than it already is (which is already really strong in-lane), they buff Strut so it's harder to remove, and they allow you to freely trigger it by triggering Impure Shots, meaning you have access to instantly triggering a semi-infinite speed-up at your leisure once in a team fight situation. Yet we're whining about a status ailment?

It's not an infinite speed up if all it takes is a random minon to flatline it.  I have yet to play a single game as MF where my passive was knocked off just because a minion made a pathing error, followed me into the brush, and knocked my passive off with one auto attack.  I'm not exaggerating.  Not once.  I feel for the Garen players who had to deal with that bullshit.

> Like, they basically buffed her fleeing/chasing as well as her in-lane bullying, but we're now whining over a status ailment being shaved in order to buff that in-lane bullying? 

Ok, how about this.  I'm going to make a champion that has a permanent 1% critical strike chance on his auto attacks.  If he crits, he instantly kills a champion, no matter how much health they have.  Here's the catch, he cannot go past 1%.  That's his passive.  OP right?  Hell no.  It's toxic as shit, but you'd never be able to use it.

Now that's an extreme example, but having a passive that's easily ignorable (remember Ashe?) is what MF players have to deal with.  Hell, when I play against a Miss Fortune, I completely disregard the fact that she has a passive MS boost, just because it's nullified so easily.  All it takes is one AA from the support to pop it off.  Annie drove me insane when she was played bot lane because of her 625 aa range.  All she had to do was attack me once, and I'd never have a passive.

> How about we just don't buff Miss Fortune so we don't have to hear it?

Like I said, "buff" is really open to interpretation at this rate.  I see two minor buffs and a gigantic nerf.  At best she's at the same power as before (not good), at worst, she's going to be worse than Elsie (who is considered to be the worst champ ATM).

I've been arguing on the Boards since yesterday that these aren't nerfs at all. And to be honest, almost every other Miss Fortune main aside from myself agrees that these are really nice buffs and that Grevious Wounds isn't the reason she's so strong.

The only thing this changes is that she can't counter less than 5 supports I think, in exchange for more mobility and a stronger early game.

(They also changed her E, they said they upped the slow early game but lowered the duration which in exchange would noticeably increase the damage.)

The more mobility part isn't true. What would be the case that her passive isn't already up? When you are fighting. When would you activate her impure shots? DURING a fight so that you get an AS buff. When would you ever activate it for the strut? To catch up to someone to fight? Because then you don't have the AS buff...

I don't really see your logic in that.

If she doesn't take damage her passive already ramps up lol, if you're chasing someone who can easily attack you while still running away, well. Don't chased Singed, Nidalee, or Ekko to begin with.

By the way, the cooldown vs the duration of her W isn't that long. The cooldown is 10 seconds if the duration is 6 seconds, it's 10 seconds of not using it and within that time, your passive will already be up anyways.

Singed is DoT so his poison won't knock out her passive now.

The New Impure Shots should theoretically act as a gap closer. They start to run, you pop W, they turn to AA, you drop E to slow their escape. Should secure a kill or two you normally wouldn't get. If you don't have your E, just let them go.

You could also reverse this for an escape. Drop an E and pop your W to flee. Probably won't work, but in theory it can.

I doubt I'll even notice the loss of Grievous Wounds.

Welp, that's one more confirmed case of Riot lazily lying to their fanbase hoping they won't catch their bullshit.

My point was that it will not pay to use her W as a gap closer when it's a stronger fighting tool than it is an engage/disengage one. It's nice, but in actuality, it will do very little for her because it is so easy to remove her strut.
Well, since it looks like they nerfed her W to 3 auto attacks... it may be worth it as a gap closer

1 and 3 - if you were in a position to lose passive, the active is completely useless.
2 -  again, highly situational/useless change applies only to early laning and nearly non-existent situations of two low HP targets running away.

its more like a Quality of life change with the removal of Grievous Wounds, which in this case is a Knee jerk reaction because there are still other forms of Grievous Wounds and other sustain champions haven't been addressed yet.

I guess you are basing the stronger laning phase purely on her ability to return to lane faster than other ADC. I don't think this mobility will ever allow her to get a whole creep wave ahead of her competition unless she is flat out better at last hitting.

Also the passive of strut is only a boost of 25 that builds to 70 over 5 seconds. Being able to reactivate strut will be canceled out with a quick AA from a minion or Champion long before it reaches its Max. Enjoy your free pair of boots for about 1 second.

Honestly, the ability to chase and escape is what Fortune really lacks. I don't worry about the whole "make her like every other ADC", since I feel the hybrid nature coincides with her Impure Shots.

I do agree that Fortune doesn't seem to do enough hybrid damage. A Fortune with Gunblade and Cleaver should decimate a stunned enemy team. Of course, they have to be stunned or they will just walk out of range. Which Fortune doesn't have a stun. She does have a slow, which I hear is being buffed, so maybe a Make it Rain/Bullet Time combo will be more viable than it has been in the past. As is, it seems starting with Rain is just an invitation for a gap closer/stun and no Bullet Time for you. There's just so much perfect positioning required for Fortune.

As for any ideas on changing her... I think her passive needs to be reversed. After taking damage, Fortune gains 70MS which reduces by 35 when out of combat for more than 3 seconds which decreases another 35 over the next 3 seconds. Everything else can stay the same till we see how that changed passive works out.

There are exactly three things that the new rework needs to make MF amazing (I think we're headed in the right direction, though)

Are you ready?

When you last hit a minion with Q, the bounce needs to prioritize champions. Missing the bounce on a champion and instead hardpushing your lane by oneshotting a caster minion feels bad man, especially when the champion and the minion in question were right next to each other and both are completely viable targets. RNG SUCKS.

W needs to PROTECT strut for the duration of the AS steroid (pls rito, being able to instantly have 70 stacks is nice but it would be better this waaaaay)

R needs an AD ratio (IT CAN BE LOW PER SHOT EVEN! PLS RITO!)

If MF gets ahead in her lane, she can dominate fights without many changes due to the level reliant nature of her ultimate's damage and scaling. These changes would slightly improve MF's lategame, but more importantly would reward MF players who were using Q to last hit with champs in range, and also give MF some mobility options in fights that weren't disabled by AAs.

Making Q's bounce more reliable would have the potential issue of making her too good at being a lane bully. r1 bounce hurts at level one. It isn't RNG, there is a targeting priority (see wiki for details)

W protecting strut would also be too good since it'd basically be a Yi Ult (sans slow immunity)

R DOES have an AD ratio. It applies stacks of Impure shots (6% ad per stack, each additional hit increasing that ratio.)

MF is clearly an AP champion

Hybrid shred on make it rain could make her borderline broken because everyone would just pick her with a high damage teamcomp and say goodbye to the enemy. It actually sounds really good.

She is just as good at building ADC as she is AP.

Her Q, W, and R still scale very well off AD. Make it Rain is NEVER used by competent MF players as damage.

It still scales off AD. If I remember, it scaled off AP anyways.

This rework, particularly the changes to Impure Shots, is retarded. I mean _literally_ retarded. I mean that only someone with a _malfunctioning brain_ could possibly think that changing MF's AS buff to only affecting _her next three attacks_ is a good idea.

MF is inarguably the _worst_ ADC in the game. She needs a rework on the level of the one they're giving Gangplank to fix her myriad of issues. Instead they're fucking around with her kit, gutting her ONE advantage (her ability to stand and duel against champions like Warwick and Swain) and doing NOTHING to fix the _mind-blowingly obvious_ flaws in her kit (for FUCK'S SAKE Riot, make it so minion autoattacks don't cancel Strut, it's _not fucking rocket science!_).
